sentences.en: As we fall asleep the amplitude of brain waves slowly becomes greater.
sentences.cn: 进入睡眠状态时，我们的脑电波振幅慢慢变大。

sentences.en: Fuddled by brandy, her brain fumbled over the events of the night.
sentences.cn: 白兰地让她脑子昏昏沉沉的，记不清楚晚上发生的事了。

sentences.en: Hallucination is common in patients who have suffered damage to the brain.
sentences.cn: 脑部受损的病人常会产生幻觉。

sentences.en: He could not dislodge the images imprinted on his brain.
sentences.cn: 他难以把刻在脑海中的形象抹去。

sentences.en: He died in 1984 of an unsuspected brain tumour.
sentences.cn: 他于1984年意外死于脑瘤。

sentences.en: He had kidney cancer, with secondary tumours in the brain and lungs.
sentences.cn: 他患有肾癌，还有脑部和肺部的继发性肿瘤。

sentences.en: He had threatened to brain him then and there.
sentences.cn: 他当时就威胁要打爆他的脑袋。

sentences.en: He was rushed to hospital for a brain scan.
sentences.cn: 他被火速送往医院做脑部扫描。

sentences.en: He was witty, amusing and gifted with a sharp business brain.
sentences.cn: 他机智诙谐，具有敏锐的商业头脑。

sentences.en: I racked my brain for hours trying to recall her name.
sentences.cn: 几小时来我苦苦思索以期回想起她的名字

sentences.en: If you don't keep your brain working you go gaga.
sentences.cn: 要是不常用脑子，你就会变得糊涂起来。

sentences.en: John has cars on the brain.
sentences.cn: 约翰心里老是惦记着汽车。

sentences.en: Messages from the brain are carried by the central nervous system.
sentences.cn: 大脑发出的信息是通过中枢神经系统传递的。

sentences.en: Neural networks are computer systems which mimic the workings of the brain.
sentences.cn: 神经网络是模拟大脑工作方式的计算机系统。

sentences.en: She beat her brains out during the examination.
sentences.cn: 在考试中她绞尽脑汁

sentences.en: She died of a brain tumour .
sentences.cn: 她死于脑瘤。

sentences.en: She died of a brain tumour.
sentences.cn: 她死于脑瘤。

sentences.en: She has a first-class brain and is a damned good writer.
sentences.cn: 她头脑相当灵光，是个非常棒的作家。

sentences.en: The bullet had entered the top part of the brain.
sentences.cn: 子弹已经进入了大脑顶部。

sentences.en: the chemistry of the brain
sentences.cn: 大脑的化学性质

sentences.en: The coach has winning on the brain.
sentences.cn: 教练一心想着取得胜利

sentences.en: The horrors he experienced are imprinted, perhaps indelibly, in his brain.
sentences.cn: 他经历的恐怖事件在他脑海中刻下了深深的，或许是难以磨灭的印记。

sentences.en: the human brain
sentences.cn: 人脑

sentences.en: The job requires brains.
sentences.cn: 做这工作需要头脑。

sentences.en: What I said sometimes didn't register in her brain.
sentences.cn: 有时我说的话她根本没听进去。

words.tran_cn: 聪明的；脑筋好的；有头脑的

phrases.tran_cn: 【非正式用语】 绞尽脑汁，大费脑筋：用光或耗尽极大的智力努力
头脑风暴法，集体创造性思维法
(非正式)萦绕于脑际，念念不忘
热衷于，念念不忘：一心想着某事
思想剽窃：在解决问题中使用别人的想法
冥思苦想：长时间艰苦地思考

trans.tran_cn: （头）脑，智力，出谋划策者，聪明的人
trans.tran_en: the organ inside your head that controls how you think, feel, and move
to hit someone very hard on the head – used humorously
